message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest acute bacterial sinusitis, which often follows a viral upper respiratory tract infection. Nasal polyps may contribute to chronic sinusitis, but not to an acute bacterial infection. Asthma may increase the risk of sinusitis, but it’s not a primary predisposing factor. Recent use of antihistamines may exacerbate symptoms, but it’s not a predisposing factor.
